intro: Galeobdolon, commonly known as the galeobdolon or the wild garlic, is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in woodland areas and shaded environments. The plant features strap-like, narrow leaves and produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers. Its bulbs are often used in traditional medicine and culinary applications. The plant is also noted for its strong garlic-like odor, which is characteristic of the genus.
